characters: I HEAR TICKING. IT TICKS ME OFFFFF
THE VIEW CLIMBS UP UP UP
THE FULL-SIZED TINK STANDS BEFORE HIM
THEY SUCK THE LIFE OUT OF YOU
A BRACE OF DIAMOND ENCRUSTED DUELING PISTOLS
HATE THE SIGHT OF MY OWN BLOOD
FOR THE REST OF YOUR MISERABLE LIFE
I BELIEVE IN FAERIES---I SWEAR I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An amazing sight. Like a float in the Rose Parade by Maxfield Parrish. A raft of giant clam shells, adorned wi Mermaids--tropical flowers--towed by a team of Dolphins.

dialogues.speaker: THE RAFT
dialogues.text: PETER! Standing at the helm flanked by Una, Babs and Angelika. Hands on his hips in familiar pose. Still 35--b a more youthful aura about him. His clothes have slowly changed to a Polo/Robinson Crusoe look. Ziggy leads the boys down the beach to meet hin.

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: Id’s Peder! He came back.
Peter jumps ashore and waves goodbye. Dolphins pull the raft away. Mermaids wave, chattering their sea sounds--~

dialogues.speaker: ANGELIKA/UNA/BABS
dialogues.text: Goodbye Peter--We love you, Peter! The Boys surround him, genuinely glad to see him. Tink can’t fight it, she flits to him and pecks his cheek with her little faerie lips turning all shades of the rainbow. Peter touches the spot, embarassed.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Oh, Peter--you’re alive. I’m so--- (catching herself, she huffs up) What’re you doing with the Aquatic Bimbos....

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: They saved me, Tink.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: (incredibly jealous) I/ll just bet. Did you tell them you’re married? Hmm? Did you? Huh? Forget ‘to mention your Kids? Uh-hunh.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Tink--will you listen? They saved me. That’s all---- A hunting horn BLEATS 0.C.. Everyone cringes. The Boys part. ZIGGY appears from his hut, blowing his ram’s horn, dragging a long sword behind.

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: I found it! Look! Id’s yours. Ziggy hoists the blade reverently to him. Peter holds it awkwardly--turning it, weighing it, a kid with a new toy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who gives a sheet, Mon? Whot can you do with Grandpa in 3 days? Who youse gonna call? Rufio cackles, grabbing his crotch, jock style at Peter.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (vowing) I/’11 do anything to save my kids. If I have to fly--I/1l fly. If I have to fight--I/1l fight!

BOYS CHEER, beating their weapons, howling, dancing aroun Peter and Tink. Peter dramatically JERKS the heavy sword from the sheath--the sheath goes flying--nearly hitting Rufio, razzing on the sloop. .

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. HOOK’S GREAT CABIN - NIGHT : HOOK SITS alone at the table head, completely depressed.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: My life...is over..... SMEE tends trying to cheer the Captain up with a lavishly spread dinner. Fine linen. Sparkling crystal. Solid gold cutlery. Cuisine fit for a 4-star King. Smee tucks his napkin in for him, decanting the wine--He props a golden fork in Hook’s hand and fastens a knife to his hook.

dialogues.speaker: . HOOK
dialogues.text: Why did I listen to that scheming Pixie? Pan’s not coming back. She can’t change him in 3 days or 3 decades. There’s not going to be (big sigh of self pity) Cheated from my own destiny by a.....chicken.

dialogues.speaker: SMEE
dialogues.text: Aye, Cap’n, "chicken". "Coq Au Vin". Just like your Mum made it. . Hook regards the steaming bird before him. With courtly manners, he splays the dressed drumlegs, rips off the little booties--and buries his hook deep in it’s groin --gouging and ripping and disemboweling the carcass with vengeance until nothing is left but....grease...

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: My Mum sent me to Boarding School. (a little sigh) +..The bitch.... Smee eyes CECCO, the handsome Italian, standing guard wit Jukes. Big trouble. They back slowly away seeking cover.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Do you know what I hate, Smee--I mean really hate?--I really hate looking forward to something--the planning--  as
Hook rearranges the table--

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: (continuing) --the anticipation-- (blinks his eyes in anticipation) the excitement-- (big wide gasp--eyes wide) He explodes raking the table with his claw--

dialogues.speaker: LAND
dialogues.text: Hook grabs a diamond studded dueling pistol from his sash

dialogues.speaker: MY LIFE IS OVERRRRR
dialogues.text: --and shoves the barrel in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: CAP/NNN
dialogues.text: HOOK PULLS the trigger. SMEE LUNGES, jamming his pointy finger in the hammerlock as it snaps shut. Smee yells. Ho yells--prying Smee’s finger lose--he jams the barrel on h nose. Smee grabs the gun with his hands. Hook and Smee wa the gun around the Great Cabin--

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: I just want to...dieeee!

dialogues.speaker: SMEE
dialogues.text: That’s not the answer, Cap‘n! CECCO AND JIKES can’t escape the line of fire. Every plac they bob and weave and crash and hide, Hook finds then. HOOK AND SMEE PANCAKE the table. Food flies. The gun FIRE THE COOK wheeling in the dessert cart drops dead in a pil of pastry. A gaping bullet hole in his heart--

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: (even more suicidal) Look what you’ve made me do! Who’s going to make me creme broule’ now? I can’t go on like this. No dessert!? (shoves another pistol in his mouth)

dialogues.speaker: SMEE
dialogues.text: (sincere, devoted) Aww, now--what kind of world would it be without Captain Hook? Aye? Deeply moved, Hook pulls the gun from his mouth--ponderin the question before hin.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Good form, Smee. What would the world be without Capt. Hook? The eternal question. He clutches Smee in an endearing hug--unaware he’s clawing Smee’s back. Suddenly paranoid, listening, he releases Smee--who’s in severe pain.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: What’s that ticking? He slashes his drapes with his sword--slicing Cecco--

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Where is it? Tick-tick-tick. There! Over here! Hah! Make it stop! SMEEE! Hook crawls on hands and knees frantic, looking under the table. He’s up inspecting the food, running his sword out series of portholes, slashing his chaise--

dialogues.speaker: SMEE
dialogues.text: There is no ticking, Cap’n. You kilt that Croc years ago. We threw all the clocks overboard--remember? Hook grabs an hour glass--listening to see if it’s tickin He smashes it. "Hooking" Smee under the collar, he lifts the bulbous man in the air.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: (ever so polite) Are you saying--there is no ticking in this room? Hmmm? That I am, shall we say, mentally unstable because I hear ticking and you do not? Is that your gist, Mr. Smee? Smee motions frantically to Cecco--who is sitting on the floor near faint from his sword wound.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Do you know what I really hate? (putting the gun to Smee’s head) PEOPLE WHO DON’T HEAR TICKING WHEN
Smee ticks his hand back and forth at Jukes. Finally--

dialogues.speaker: JUKES/CECCO
dialogues.text: "tick-tock-tick-tock-tick-tock" Hook abruptly drops Smee--listening as if hearing angels. HOOK . There...See? "Ticking".

dialogues.speaker: SMEE
dialogues.text: (pouring him a drink) Cap’n, me thinks you. need a little somethin’ to take yer mind off this Pan business. Let’s go ashore’n kill some Indians. You hate Indians, too.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: (whining like a spoiled kid) We always kill Indians. I don’t want to kill Indians. I want to kill Pan. Hook curls up in a fetal ball on the baywindow seat.

dialogues.speaker: SMEE
dialogues.text: Don’t torture yersef, Cap’n. Y’can’t let the men see you this way.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: (curling in a tighter ball) I don’t care. It’s all I’ve been living for. This little boy of youth and joy--all goody and sweet. And I, Jas. Hook--I would gut the conceited pest like a pig and feed his ado.escent entrails to the bilge rats. (punctuating with mimed sword) What fun.... (he wells up) What’s the use? What’s the point? He’s taken all the joy out of it. He’s not worth killing. Pan’s done it again...Peter the Schlub beat me. Why can‘t I win just once? Is that too much to ask?

dialogues.speaker: SMEE
dialogues.text: Lookit the bright side, Capn’, if’in Pan doesn’t show--you still git to deep 6 his ruddy rotten curtain crawlers.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: (brightens then delfates, morose) Kill Pan’s kids?--That would be.... “bad form". But a deal is a deal. And Jas. Hook is a man of his word.

dialogues.speaker: . SMEE
dialogues.text: Cap/n--there is another way. You don’t have to kill’em--ef’en they sign the blood oath and join your crew-- Hook thinks about it. Devious. But "nayyyyyy".

dialogues.speaker: SMEE
dialogues.text: Wait--better. Yes, a thousand times blacker--Make the little morons love you--

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: It’s Pan they love. Even you, Smee, are lovable. No little children love me. Crushed with rejection, Hook grabs his second pistol and shoves it in his mouth again. Smee pulls it out--

dialogues.speaker: SMEE
dialogues.text: That’s the point, Cap’n! The ultimate revenge! Pan’s kids in love with Hook! The ultimate "pay back", Cap/’n. Hook relaxes his trigger finger, piqued.

dialogues.speaker: SMEE
dialogues.text: Can you ‘magine the look on Peter’s puss when he faces you and his kids standing right beside you! Ready to fight for the sleaziest sleaze of the seas....Cap’n Hook!

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: (caught up) . I like it. It has a certain symmetry.

dialogues.speaker: SMEE
dialogues.text: You’d make a fine father, Cap’n, if I do say so, mesef. We are horrified. Hook is horrified. Then intrigued. Then enamored. Hook begins to laugh at the notion, almost gidd escalating to hysterical. Smee joins in. Then Cecco and Jukes roaring with uncontrollable laughter.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: "Captain Hook--and Family!" "The Family Hook!" Captain Hook--Family Man!"

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON CAPTAIN HOOK
dialogues.text: He subsides. A serene smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: The Hooks...A family...to love... Hook sucks slowly on the barrel like nursing Mum’s breast

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SHIP’S HOLD - NIGHT - TIGHT ON CHAINS RATS follow the chains across barefeet. Maggie and Jack huddle, chained to their oars. She SCREAMS. Jack kicks at the ugly things. A HAND snatches a big Rat on Maggie’s le The YOUNG SLAVE chained next to her dangles the squealing vermin by it’s tail. He smiles, showing his rotty teeth.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG. SLAVE
dialogues.text: The big ones always go for the freshies like youse two. Maggie buries her head against Jack.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I want to see Mommy. Daddy won’t forget us---will he?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What’s the difference. We’re on our own, squirt.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SLAVE
dialogues.text: I been in in this scumhole 20 years. Don’t remember what a "Daddy" or "Mommy" is. Yu/ll fogit, too. ¥fogit everthing. The kid can’t be more than 12. He whams the rat by the ta against the floor until it’s dead. He offers it.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SLAVE
dialogues.text: You can have firsties. Maggie gags. Jack holds her close trying to make it go away. It won’t.

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: Sleeping. A Ram’s horn enters frame next to his ear. BAROOMPH! Ziggy blows hard. Peter jerks awake, bonking hi head on Tink’s little house hanging above.

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: Move it! You got 2 minutes! GO! GO! Ziggy drops down a rope-slide 30 feet to the ground. TINK EMERGES from her little house, stretching, yawning from a bad night. Her hair looks like the Bride of Frankenstein. No sparkle. Eyes bloodshot. Peter looks askance. He’s never seen her like this before

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: (major morning grouch) What’re you looking at. You don’t look so hot in the morning either. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost Boys load a giant slingbow onto the Avenger. Lots of activity can be seen all over the ship.

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: Marches back and forth dragging Peter's long sword in the dirt, tripping at each about-face. Peter sits on a log trying to take the little guy seriously.

dialogues.speaker: . ZIGGY
dialogues.text: Thu only way tu be a kid is to akt like uh kid. Thad takez a lod of un- discipline--tons of not following orders....and no naps!

dialogues.speaker: , ACE
dialogues.text: Go play in the quicksand, Zig. ACE shoves Ziggy out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: Hey, Scuzz, I’m running this part.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: Who made you God? Beat it, porklips.

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: You wanna make me, zitface?! The two boys rip into each other kicking and punching.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Hey! Cut it out! Hey! --pulling ACE off Ziggy. Ziggy takes the opportunity to kick ACE repeatedly.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Did you hear me!? Cut it out or you are going to get in big trouble! ACE and Ziggy stop immediately~-copping attitudes.

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: Wur goin’ to "ged in big trubull"?

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: That’s: adult talk, Peter. Cut it if you wanna be a kid again.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: We've only got 2 days! You’re wasting time. What am I supposed to say?

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: Whend you/re mad at some scug, you say, "Go suck a dead dog’s nose" Peter, shakes "No way"--"Get serious". They wait.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (monotone) Okay, "go suck a dead dog’s nose" That’s disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: Mean it!

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Go suck a dead dog’s nose!!

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (starting to get angry) GO SUCK A DEAD DOG’S NOSE!

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: That’s better.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I know you are but what am I? Ziggy whistles, urging Peter on, whispering hints between phrases.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I know you are but what am I?

dialogues.speaker: BUTTFACE
dialogues.text: Peter waves Ziggy off trying one on his own.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMECIUM BRAIN
dialogues.text: Silence. ACE and Ziggy look at each other. "What?"

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: Whudz uh pear-uh-mezium?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (timid, unsure of the rules) «+eA one celled animal with no brain? Peter waits hoping for approval. ACE and Zig grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOST BOYS load large rocks onboard the ship.

dialogues.speaker: BY THE TREEHOUSE
dialogues.text: Rufio readies “engarde" with Peter’s sword.

dialogues.speaker: RUFIO
dialogues.text: I’m only doin’ this one time--watch. ACE and Ziggy hurl continuous coconuts at him. IN A BLUR, Rufio slices and cracks each coconut skewering the last on the tip of the blade--chugging the fresh milk
Peter, overwhelmed, looks at Tink, now her feisty beautif self, watching from underneath a sunflower umbrella, doin her toes. She’s all smiles. "Piece of cake".

dialogues.speaker: RUFIO
dialogues.text: Your turn, Grandpa. Rufio holds out the sword. Peter reaches for it. Rufio drops it in the dirt, passing by Tink who sneers at him. Peter holds the heavy sword in both hands. Nervous. Rufio juggles 3 coconuts pitching them at him. Peter doesn’t even get close with the sword. 3 direct hit to his head. BONK. BINK. KERPLOPADA. Tink hangs her little head. Long day. Rufio gloats. ACE and Ziggy fold their arms and shake the heads. Clearing throats. One release of flatulence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TINK PACES in mid-air, all business.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: It’s just like swimming. You just have to jump in and remember. Right? Peter stands on a mound overlooking the Camp and Cove. Nervous, nodding, shaking out his arms.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Swimming. Okay. Got itr ZIGGY, ACE and the other boys wait at the other end of th clearing. ACE has a "spyglass" for tracking.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH IN HIS TREE
dialogues.text: Reclining on his hammock. TINK goes over a little "pre-flight" checklist

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (marking list) Pixie dust? Peter grabs her wings shaking glowing dust all over him.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Check.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Happy thought? Peter. Blank look. Then a lecherous grin. He closes his eyes and runs--flapping his arms--

dialogues.speaker: . PETER
dialogues.text: Angelika! Una! B-B-Babs! Oo-Oo-ahh-- PETER LEAPS AND CRASHES to the ground--right in front of the Lost Boys. They laugh and jeer. Ziggy marks Peter’s landing with an "x" in the dirt--

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: (trying to stay positive) Altitude--2 feet. Distance--2 feet. RUFIO hoots hysterical heaving his half-eaten mango.

dialogues.speaker: RUFIO
dialogues.text: He flies like uh fatto elephant! PETER ROLLS OVER just as the juicy pit splats him.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: (hovering over him) Think as a child--not a sex-maniac.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: He glows with pixie dust.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Try "Christmas". Closing his eyes, he starts to run, flapping again.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Christmas--christmas--snow--presents. (euphoria disentegrates) Bills..bills I can’t pay--Ccredit cards--with sharp pointy teeth-- He CRASHES HARD, skidding into a bamboo water flume-- collapsing the entire structure--drenching himself. TINK PACES, disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: "Christmas" always works. You’re such a--a--"grownup". Spoken like the worst expletive. Rufio cackles in the b.g
INT. SHIP’S HOLD - DARKNESS The hatch opens. Light streams down on Jack and Maggie. Slaves shrink back, blinded by the light. HOOK APPEARS, blocking the light. Charming smile.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Time for school. INT. HOOK’S GREAT CABIN - DAY Hook, the ultimate teacher’s nightmare, is holding class. He writes in elegant hand on a chalk board.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Now pay attention, "Class"-- Jack and Maggie sit ill at ease at Hook’s ornate desk, wi quill and ink and paper.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Where’s my daddy? My Mommy doesn’t hate me--you mean stinky old man. . Hook smiles, tracing his claw down her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Is that any way to address your teacher. You don’t want to bring down the grade curve for the rest , oz the class, do you. Hmmmm? | Jack pulls Maggie to him, motioning her to be quiet. HOOK . A wise young man. If you don’t fail the exam--you don’t . He smashes his ruler down hard on the desk, startling bot children.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: First question. What do parents really mean when they say "I love you"? Maggie raises her hand, begging to be called on.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I know--I know--
Jack wants no part of this, pulling Maggie’s hand down. S insists. Hook scans the room as if it were full.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: (pointing to Maggie) The cute little urchin in the front row.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: They mean we make them really really really really happy all the time.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: (slamming his ruler)

dialogues.speaker: WRONG
dialogues.text: Maggie recoils, near tears. Jack is riveted.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Mommy and Daddy love you only when you do what they tell you-- Jack squirms uneasy. This is scary.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: "Wake up", "get dressed", "brush your ll teeth", "don’t get cavities", "don’t make bad grades", "clean your room", "eat your breakfast", "don’t forget your lunch", "don’t eat sweets", "don’t eat junk between meals", "do your home- work", "don’t pick on your sister", "don’t pick your nose", "don’t watch TV", "turn the music down", "sit up straight", “use your napkin", "don’t talk with your mouth full", "say please and thank you", "don’t talk back", "go to bed right now", "don’t cross the street", "don’t talk to strangers" "turn that light out this instant" "don’t do this ~-don’t do that", "don’t have fun", "don’t even breathe" and DON’T PLAY

dialogues.speaker: NEAR OPEN WINDOWS
dialogues.text: Maggie is crying by the end of Hook’s tyrade. Hook leans, daubing her eyes. He smiles politely right in Jack’s face

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Ring a bell....Jack? - He gestures like a symphony conductor. Smee appears wit i \ tiny "triangle" and tings it. "TINGGGGGG". Jack nods UL so shakey.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: And now--the dreaded "pop quiz". Hook flips the chalk board over, reading the one lone question aloud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Do my parents love me?...A, yeS.... B, no...." (passing out paper) Remember, your future depends on it. You may begin. Hook turns over a large hourglass. Maggie instantly marks her test paper "A" and turns it over. She looks to Jack-- He’s vapor locked, staring at his paper, completely stumped. Sweating, ringing his hands in anguish. Maggie elbows him hard. "Jack....?" Hook is delighted with the progress. , cUuT To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A log table. Food piled high. Peter sits between ACE and Zig. He has a black eye, a head bandage, bruises, aches a pains. The Lost Boys dig in--eating with their hands. Belching. Talking with their mouth full. Peter picks up his knife and fork. Everybody stares.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: We don’t use’en. ACE grabs Peter’s cutlery and hurls them away.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (adult logic) If you don’t use them--then why are they here?

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: (child logic) So we don’d have to use’en. ACE jams Peter’s hands in his food. Peter eats. It’s mess

Ziggy shows him how to wipe his hands on his shirt and hi mouth on the back of his sleeve like a third base coach giving the "hit and run". Peter tries it. A tentative wipe. The Boys cheer. Tink applauds from her seat at the head of the roast pig the center of the table.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Please pass the--

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: (whips out his broadsword) You said the "P" word.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Okay, okay--

dialogues.speaker: ACE
dialogues.text: Not "Okay, okay--" (stuffs food in his mouth) Okaf Okaf...

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (stuffing food in his mouth) Okaf..Okaka... Ziggy opens his mouth showing Peter his chewed food. So d the others, showing the disgusting contents. Peter guts it up, opening his showing them back. ACE lets out the world’s longest belch. Ziggy starts the cacaphony of BELCHES around the table. Long,. short, juicy, terminal. All eyes turn to Peter. Peter sucks in and sucks in--a little belch escapes... The Boys react like he split the first atom. Tink laughs hard she falls off the roast pig. CcuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZIG BLAMS PETER right in the snotlocker with his pillow. Peter staggers back, swinging his pillow wildly. Feathers fly. Lost Boys rain blows on Peter in a major pillow war. TINK WATCHES him from her little apartment up in the ceiling. Peter is having a ball. She is elated.
ACE and Zig hold Peter down, tickling him. Others pile on He laughs uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Stop it--Enough!--Hey!--STOP IT! Peter grabs Zig, shoving him away with his foot. He stands--chastising the boys. An adult again.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Are you deaf? Didn’t you hear what I said? STOP! The boys stare at him dumbfounded. Tink is crushed. Peter knows he blew it. Instant remorse. He storms out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter leans against a deck limb, staring out at the cove. All 3 Neverland Moons shine full in different colors. Tink lights beside him. They sit in silence.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: You sure know how to kill a party.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I can’t do it, Tink....

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: You’ve got to. Find one pure innocent “happy thought" and hold on to it... What used to make you happy is what makes you fly.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: What if I can’t? My kids will...die. He trails off in grim silence. Tink, softening for the first time in her faerie life, takes his hand in her tiny one and squeezes it tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think happy thoughts, Peter.

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: It KABOOMS belching fire and smoke right at us.

EXT. BEACH - DAY - CONTINUING ACTION i A giant palm tree takes a direct hit, exploding into toothpicks. Coconuts disentegrate. EXT. HOOK’S SHIP - QUARTER DECK - CONTINUING ACTION Hook langors in his lounge chair under an open Caravan te pitched on the deck. The "Long Tom" cannon smoking on one side of him, a lavish spread of food on the other. SLAVE BOYS reload "Long Tom". JACK AND MAGGIE appear from the hold escorted by Jukes. They react to the bright sun like little Vampires. SMEE bounds up and bows low.

dialogues.speaker: SMEE
dialogues.text: And ‘ow would you like to see a real live Mermaid, Miss Maggie?

dialogues.speaker: . MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I don’t like you. My Mommy showed me where to kick mean men like you and run. Smee guards himself taking her firmly by the shoulder. He escorts her away. Jack doesn’t like it.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK, (0C)
dialogues.text: Jack--my boy. Hook beckons from his tent lighting his twin cigars, boot propped on the cannon.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Where’s he taking my sister?

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Come aboard. Come aboard. We’1l discuss it, like..."Men". Breathe that sea air. (breathes deep, exalting) Hungry? Have some breakfast. I’m trying out a new chef. I’m very interested in your opinion. Jack gapes at the huge spread of nothing but desserts.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: I recommend the Napoleon. Fabulous. Chocolate eclairs. Bavarian creme--
PUSH IN ON JACK: Torn. He shakes his head reluctantly "no

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: (pats the cannon fondly) "Long Tom"’s just a big toy, Jack. The truth be known, I’m just a big kid at heart...I just have bigger toys. And like all-children...I have a natural born talent for..destruction. He touches off the cannon again. It ROARS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A direct hit on a building. Raining brick and timber everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: Placing his arm around Jack’s shoulder, admiring his ain.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: The best part--nobody is going to make you clean up the mess.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (backs away, resisting) I’m not allowed to play with guns.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Not allowed? NOT ALLOWED? Who said? Sounds like some adult who doesn’t trust you. A Daddy who broke promises. Someone who says they love you...but is never there when you need them most..... Hook has pushed the button on Jack’s pent up anger.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Now if I were 10 or 11, and someone gave me a cannon to play with--- Well....who knows... Hook hands Jack a lit cigar, bows and leaves. Jack stares at the cigar--he takes a taboo drag--feeling his power.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW HOOK
dialogues.text: Up the stairs to his great cabin. KABOOM! The Cannon roar in the f.g. Hook stops, savoring the moment. He does a little "Bojangles" tap up the steps and enters his cabin.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK, (VO)
dialogues.text: Good form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER sets "en garde". He’s ready. He blurs through a series of parries, slashes and thrusts. Wow! ACE and Ziggy give the "thumbs up" to Tink.

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: Looking good. RUFIO. WINDS UP, indicating "curve ball". He delivers. PETER CUTS a swathe--missing. The coconut knocks him to t ground. Faces fall. - ZIGGY pitches a coconut UNDERHANDED to Peter. He swings misses! The sword goes SAILING-- TINK DUCKS! The sword just misses her. She curses in faerie-speak, kicking over her umbrella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lost Boys line the ridge, holding their collective breath. Tink bristles checking over Peter’s flight list. ° TINK . You’re going to fly today even if I have to beat a "happy thought" into you. From the top. "Birthdays". Peter, exhausted and battered, grimaces. "Again"?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Birthdays... Closing his eyes, he starts to run flapping again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Presents! Yes! More presents! He jumps getting airborne--feet pedaling air. Up! Up! This is it! Yes!

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (continuing) Another year older. Getting older-- Dead! Dying! I hate birthdays... HE STALLS! HE DROPS like a rock--A perfect full layout SPLAT into the bog below.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I’m not supposed to eat sweets before breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: This is breakfast, Jack. (holding one in Jack’s face) Besides...who’s going to stop you? Jack’s starving. He woofs down an eclair--devouring a Napoleon. Hook smiles, turning back to the view. Jack hesitates. He reaches out--taking Hook’s sword hangi on the chair--he lunges--chopping at Hook’s black mane-- Hook’s right arm BLURS--CLANG!--blocking the blow against his GLEAMING HOOK without even looking. He wrenches the blade away from Jack.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: (long sardonic smile) Jack..Jack...Jack...fine name, "Jack". How about "Red-Jack"? Has a ring to it-- (rings a goblet with his hook) Smoke? Opening his humidor--puffing perfect smoke rings.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (why didn’t Hook kill me?) I don’t smoke.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Good form. Shows strength of charac- ter. I have none of course. There are some advantages tu this disgusting habit that balance the dangers--- He languidly droops his twin cigar ashes over the fire po on Long Tom. The fuse hisses. The CANNON FIRES belching fire and smoke between them. Ja covers his ears ducking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful rock formation explodes. Sand and water erupt MERMAIDS sunning dive into the waters seeking cover.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: (sadistic laugh) Try your luck? Hit the target--win a prize. | .
Rufio turns leading the Lost Boys away one by one. Only Ziggy remains on the ridge with Tink.

dialogues.speaker: WITH PETER
dialogues.text: He gets up, slinging mud.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: That's it! I quit! Ziggy and Tink rush up.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I can’t think like a kid--I can’t act like a kid because I’m not a kid. He pushes by railing at everything and everyone.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I can’t fight and I CAN’T FLY! Tootles was right. You grow up, you stop believing, you find out life sucks-- and then you die. (grim silence, he subsides) We'll just have to find some other way...to get Maggie and Jack...

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: There is no other way, Peter! Tink stews in one direction. Peter in another. He trips over a log right in the mud. Ziggy helps him up. They sit on the log. Peter broods. Ziggy removes a leathe pouch from around his neck, weighing it like precious gen

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: Peder, I’membur Toodles. He wuz one of us. Lookit. Theez are his marbuls. Theez are his happy thoughds. He lefa them behind. They dond work for me... Maybe they wull fur you.... He dumps the marbles in Peter’s hand. Non-descript.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: They’re just marbles, Ziggy.

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: Wull, whad happened to Toodles? TINK LIGHTS on Peter’s hand, checking out the marbles lik a diamond merchant.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Wendy took him back with the others-- to grow up and go to school--and go to an office--and be a gentleman.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: "Poor. kind Tootles." He didn’t make a very good grown-up.

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: (welling up) Toodles god old? Heez gonna die? Don’d led Toodles die. Give him back theez. ' It hits Tink. Staring at her distorted reflection in a Cat’s Eye marble.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Ziggy--you’ve got to do this. Get the Boys and go to Princess Ti. Beg a truce.

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: Whad? She’1l barbecue our budds.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Tell her the one true Pan is coming. Trust me. C’mon, Peter! Hurry! She blurs away leaving Peter and Ziggy at a loss--

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: Beddur do whad she sez. She gedz like this sometimes. I guess I/11 never understand Pixies. Zig waddles off in the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Tink! Where’re you going? Peter limps after her--all aches and pains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun’s rays barely penetrate the dense forest. Peter climbs over a huge felled tree. Tink’s aura twinkles ahea

dialogues.speaker: SLOW DOWN TINK
dialogues.text: (banging his shin) I/11 kill her. I swear I will. (stops in awe at the sight ahead)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sprawling ancient sentinel. Burned and charred, but refusing to fall. Limbs, trunk and branches twist and tur 100 feet into the sunset sky.

dialogues.speaker: . PETER
dialogues.text: I know this place.... Peter approaches the monument. Drawn to it by a powerful force. He traces the charred bark reverently with his han A stray ray of sunlight illuminates the trunk before hin. Something is carved on it. He brushes away the soot and a with building anticipation-- Letters take shape in the trunk. Names. Carved like ancie Rhunes---Peter rejoices with each revelation!

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: "Tootles"...

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: "Wendy"...I’m home, Wendy, I’m...home. Tracing her name--with manly tears of lost youth and days that will never be again. . The light on the carvings grows and spreads. Peter looks shading his eyes from the glare.

dialogues.speaker: THE GIANT TREE
dialogues.text: Filled with a 1,000 beams of intense twinkling lights descending toward him. The air alive with chiming voices. FAERIES and PIXIES and’ NYMPHS and SYLPHS of all ages and species descend to him--buzzing in close for a good look, then darting away--speaking their singsong language. TINK LIGHTS on his outstretched hand. She is regal. Weari a magnificent crown and flowing gown fit for a queen. She bows low with all the poise of a great ruler. Peter, compelled, bows his head in return.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Tink....you’re.... beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: (blushing) Oh puhleeze. Do you like the dress? She does a full turn. Peter nods like a big kid--the grow man part can’t take his eyes off her. °

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: These are my kind, Peter. I am their Queen. They came to help.... Faeries whizz and buzz about him. A little one pulls his hair. Another plops on his nose sizing him up. Peter chuckles, making faces, completely at ease and enchanted.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Help me? FAERIES PULL AND TUG him like a big puppet into the trunk of the giant tree. The entire tree glows from within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter descends in a rickety wicker basket contraption int a black void. FAERIES STREAM DOWN from above following Tink lighting up cavernous room.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL
dialogues.text: Where Wendy played Mother to Peter and the Lost Boys. A huge-walkin fireplace dominates one end of the vast room. The remains of beds the other. A smashed rocking chair. Everything is charred from a great fire. Mushrooms abound Peter is stunned, elated and saddened as he touches down.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Do you know where you are?

dialogues.speaker: . PETER
dialogues.text: (nodding sadly) What...happened?

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Hook burned it when you didn’t come back. Peter sadly rummages the ruins of a kid-sized red Playhouse. It’s burned and chopped to pieces. PETER ‘ Wendy’s house. Tootles and Nibs built it for her. I remember. I remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 06/21/90 86 Emotions and memories flood in. In the fireplace, he discovers his "Pan" flute. He savors it, attempting a few notes. He gets mouth full of soot.

dialogues.speaker: . PETER
dialogues.text: I need music lessons too, Tink. He pitches the flute, angry remorse. He kicks at catches his

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Why did you bring me here? There’s nothing here....but...sad things. (kicking around) This is not working, Tink. Let’s get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: There’s no place else to go, Peter. You were happy here once upon a time.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: It’s gone. It’s all gone. Everything. the charred remains of his youth. Something attention. He picks up a Teddy Bear. Charred. One eye missing. The truth...

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: "“Taddy"...aw Taddy. My "Mother" put Taddy in my pram...to keep me company.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: What else? Tell me...

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I remember my Mother--and my Father looking down at me--talking about how I would grow up, and go to a fine school, and be smart and learn things--then go off to an office and be an impor- tant businessman. And then fall in love, get married...and raise a family...and be happy...

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Isn‘t that what all Grown-ups want for their children?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Yeah...it is.....
Peter is overwhelmed with the realization.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: But I was afraid. I ran away from 2 people who loved me--because I didn’t want to grow up.....and die.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: You’re only...human...

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: That’s what I’ve been trying to tell you...I never even told them I loved them... Peter hits bottom. Complete remorse.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: But you went back, Peter. You left here and went back. What made you stop being afraid to grow up and...die?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I DON’T KNOW! I CAN’T REMEMBER! Breaking point. He hurls Taddy into the void--

dialogues.speaker: TADDY RISES
dialogues.text: Turning in dream-like motion--FAERIES swarm around it, catching it. They float the bear slowly back toward Peter

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON PETER
dialogues.text: Something snaps inside him. A memory. He reaches up. Tadd lands gently into his outstretched hands--

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: What, Peter? What is it?

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON PETER
dialogues.text: A perfect blue sky. The INFANT, PETER rises into the air. Completely free. No fear. His little belly rumbling the laughter of innocence and mirth that can only happen befo you know something is wrong with the world--

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I’m.....flying.... Peter the infant descends, big giggling grin, little arms flapping--A WOMAN’S ARMS REACH UP=-catching him. Peter’s BEAUTIFUL MOTHER nuzzles him--all loving--

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Mother....catches me. She’s soft...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: Mother pitches Peter into the air again. He rises toward flapping and giggling--higher--reaching to the birds abov him. He peaks, laughing, and turns, slowly descending--

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Fly me, Taddy! Fly me--- A MAN’S ARMS REACH UP. Peter descends toward a handsome smiling YOUNG MAN--"DADDY"!

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ---Taddy? No...DADDY! Fly me--Daddy-- He floats into his Daddy’s arms who rubs his nose with hi and vaults him back into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I---love---you.... .

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON PETER
dialogues.text: Tears of joy stream from his closed eyes.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I have my happy thought. I know why I went back. I know....

dialogues.speaker: THE LIFEFLASH CHANGES
dialogues.text: ARMS REACH up to catch Maggie. It’s Moira! ARMS REACH UP catch Jack. It’s Peter!

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON PETER
dialogues.text: He opens his eyes--disoriented--clutching his bear.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Tink! I know--Whoaaaa! He looks down. He’s sitting cross-legged 15 feet above th cavern floor! Faeries buzz about tinkling and chiming. He drops. Tink zooms up beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as,
He reaches for her--automatically flying in her direction

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: TINKKKKK! I can flyyyy! Peter bounces off the cavern wall, rappelling at Tink.

dialogues.speaker: ---FOLLOW ME
dialogues.text: TINK spirals toward the ceiling. Peter punches his hands "up" and ascends. Faeries swirl about him like bubbles.

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING DOWN
dialogues.text: TINK CLIMBS toward us lacing her glowing web. PETER ASCENDS behind her, crowing--that’s right--giggling like the child he was, full and free. Whooping and shouti with the rush of flight! FAERIES PEEL OFF in Busby Berkley precision and collect o the giant tree--chiming and waving "good bye"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TINK BURSTS through a pink cloud and stops. PETER FOLLOWS. Tink ambushes him. Blowing a raspberry and fanning her ears. He dodges tumbling into a cloud bank.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: How do I stop!

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: (tapping her temple) It’s all in the mind, ya now! Peter thinks. He stops. Wow. Tink blurs up to him.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Staring at the Neverland sunset.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: You did it. You found your happy thought. It’s yours forever, Peter. _ No one can take it away.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: (seeing his tears) Why are you crying?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (wiping his eyes, embarassed) I don’t know--I was just thinking. I just wish--- He looks at Tink, trying to find the words.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: You can wish, Peter. Whatever you want.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (breaking the moment) Would you look at that unbelievable Sunset! I know what my kids mean now when they say, "Awesome, Dudeeee!"  _ He pushes off speeding toward the huge ball of orange.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: It is like swimming! Watch this!

dialogues.speaker: WITH PETER
dialogues.text: He stalls like a highdiver doing a "dying swan". He dives making sounds like an airplane--just like a kid. TINK DIVES with him. Both screaming toward the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Tink dive at us. Peter doing his airplane noise

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You're too low. Pull out! Pull out! (doing John Wayne) Easy, Pilgrim, the force is with us. He levels off skimming the surface. SHARK FINS knife the waters ahead.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (doing "JAWS") Doot-dah-doot~dah-doot-dah-- He ZOOMS BY fapping shark fins with a forehand--a backhan He signals a slamdunk--"Two!" TINK SHRIEKS, dodging a hungry shark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHALES SOUND ahead. Spuming cascades of spray. PETER & TINK blow through it, exulting with pure ecstasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Tink bank across the sun and descend. Hundreds Flamingos rise up from the Lagoon filling the sky.

dialogues.speaker: WITH PETER
dialogues.text: Surrounded by the magnificent birds.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW
dialogues.text: Angelika, Una and Babs leap with Dolphins.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRIO
dialogues.text: It’s Peter! He found it! Hi, Peter! He’s such a hunk.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Hullo, Ladies! Look at me! I’m flying! He does an "Inside Loop" showing off. Tink speeds up, lights on his shoulder and covers his eye

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I don’t want this to end, Tink. I don’t want to ever come down.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: (empathizing) Save your strength, flyboy. You’re going to need it. She steers him down over the island.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Hey~-there’s the Indian Camp. I can’t wait to see the look on Rufio’s face. He whoops and yahoos all the way down.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON RUFIO
dialogues.text: Terrified. Staked out for torture with Ziggy, ACE, and th rest of the Boys. Warriors chant their imminent death. PRINCESS TI stands before Rufio, oiled and painted for battle. She pets a deadly "Black Adder" snake like a kitt

dialogues.speaker: TI
dialogues.text: The Great Pan is not coming. You die.

dialogues.speaker: RUFIO
dialogues.text: Princess Ti, babe, itz not us. Itzat dam faerie. Itz all her fault. Her and that scumball old Mon. Truss me-- The snake hisses in his face. Ziggy hears it first. WHOOPING and HOOTING above. He looks up. He grins.

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: Look! Heez no "Scumball"! Heez "Peder Pan"!

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Out of the night sky, screaming the cavalry charge. He lands hard right in front of Ti sliding in the dirt li he’s stealing second. He jumps up making the call complet

dialogues.speaker: PETER THE UMPIRE
dialogues.text: Safe! You’re in there! Indians back away in fear. Peter leaps to Rufio, pinching his cheeks and checking his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Rufio! My Mon. Whadz happening? He winks at Ziggy and darts to Ti, bowing low in mid-air.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Forgive me, Princess Ti, I was.... surrounded, yeah, by...Pirates. There must’ve been...a 100. No. 200! We ran out of pixie dust. I barely escaped. You see--nothing could keep me from you--and this moment. Let’s party. TINK PLOPS on a branch overlooking the scene. Exhausted. She marvels at the "Old Pan" back in rare form as Peter kisses Ti’s hand. Ti studies Peter. She raises her "kissed" hand in the air Warriors draw their bows and cock their spears. Ti’s ston face suddenly melts into a girlish grin. With her hand, s pulls Peter close for a torrid kiss. Everybody CHEERS. Warriors free the Lost Boys. Drums beat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oN i,
TINK lets out a big sigh. Happy for Peter, but hurting inside. She’s done her job. Peter is Pan again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A major tribal celebration is in full sway. Warriors and Lost Boys jam with long cane flutes, primitive stringed intruments and all kinds of percussion gear. Rufio watches from the sidelines, chugging some drink fro a huge gourd..He’s getting surly by the mouthful.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE WAR COUNCIL RING
dialogues.text: Peter sits with Ti. Ziggy and ACE on his side, 2 huge Warriors on Ti’s. Peter points with his sword around a . battle map drawn in the sand. We see the island. Ziggy guides Hook’s ship. Ti motions. The Warriors push sticks from their position to cut Hook off. ACE surprises Hook with the Dark Avenger amidships. Peter ares a little Pan doll in a circular flight plan sneaking up behind. Suddenly, SAND KICKS IN ruining the battle map. RUFIO kicks sticks and ships away with a vengeance.

dialogues.speaker: RUFIO
dialogues.text: So--IT can fly--but can IT fight?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Easy, Rufio. Save IT for Hook. Rufio laughs. Without warning, he wheels, hurling a cocon at Peter-- Peter ducks. His hand instinctively BLURS with his sword SKEWERING THE COCONUT perfectly-- Rufio glares in disbelief. So does Peter. Rufio madly hur another and another-- Peter whirls--parrying and slicing them cleanly in two. Coconut pieces land in front of Ziggy. He’s amazed.

dialogues.speaker: RUFIO
dialogues.text: Let’s go for some "real". --drawing his sword in one hand--stiletto in the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a
Ti backs everyone up giving them room. She digs the actio

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I don’t want to fight you-- Rufio attacks. Peter’s hand instinctively blocks and counters every blow. Rufio backs off amazed. Peter shrugs at Ziggy. "What"? Zig shrugs back, loving it

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: Yur Pan, man. A natural. Rufio attacks while Peter is in a fog. Peter ducks with a 6th sense, sweeping Rufio to the dirt, blade at his throa

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: It’s just like riding a bike, Rufe.

dialogues.speaker: RUFIO
dialogues.text: Kill me, old mon. You won.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (leaning on his blade) The thought did cross my mind. But I-need you, Rufio. When I face Hook, you better be there covering my butt. Rufio hesitates, looking at everybody around them. He realizes what a complete butthead he’s been.

dialogues.speaker: RUFIO
dialogues.text: Me? R’ you talkin’ to me? Peter removes his sword extending his hand. Rufio takes hold, pulling himself up.

dialogues.speaker: RUFIO
dialogues.text: You truss me? Okay, cool. Yur on, Mon. Peter grins. Rufio shows all his gold teeth. They bearhug The Lost Boys high-five Rufio. All is forgiven. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noodler pounds a spike fixing Maggie’s shackles fast toa beam. He locks her other manacles onto an oar.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Where’s Jack? Where’s my brother? Noodler’s sadistic laugh echoes through the galley. cUuT TO:

INT. HOOK’S GREAT CABIN - NIGHT Jack, spiffed and cleaned, stands in front of a mirror. Smee hands a Louis the 14th wide brimmed plumed hat to Ho with great pomp and circumstance. Hook places it atop Jack’s head, cocking it just so. Snapping his fingers, Smee hands over a gentleman’s box. Hook opens it for Jack--

dialogues.speaker: A BRACE OF DIAMOND ENCRUSTED DUELING PISTOLS
dialogues.text: Jack's jaw drops at the sight. Hook indicates "for you". Hook snaps his fingers again. Jack grins slow and wide-- A BEAUTIFUL CABIN GIRL pours Jack a tall chocolate: malte Her ample bosoms filling his view as she leans in front o him topping it off with gobs of whipped cream. Hook places a straw in the concoction.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Welcome to Neverland. Jack takes a.long pull on the straw. This is great. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first rays of morning sun sneak over the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lost Boys. are sprawled about the deck asleep. Some still sport souvenirs from the Indian celebration. Ziggy snores up in the Crow’s nest. Tink is nowhere to be seen. Peter, unable to sleep, watches the sun come up. He shive with a spine chill. He gazes up at the treehouse. Tink’s faerie aura flickers from the window.

dialogues.speaker: . PETER
dialogues.text: Hullo? Tink? I just want to. say-- thanks, you know--for everything. Quiet sobbing drifts down from Tink’s house. Her glow is weak. He stands on tiptoe, peeking in.
INT. TINK’S ROOM - PETER IN VIEW An “exquisite boudoir and bedroom combined". Tink is lyin on her 4 poster, quietly sobbing. By the looks of her, she’s been at it all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tink--are you okay? What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Of course I’m okay. Nothing’s wrong. She rolls away, sobbing harder and bigger tears.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: If nothing’s wrong, why all the tears?

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Because...I’m sad.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: What are you sad about? Look, I’m my old self again. Isn’t that you wanted? She nods, blowing her little nose.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: No matter how this turns out--I‘/m not afraid anymore. You, Tink--you gave me back something I’d lost. I forgot what it was like to be alive. I/11 never forget this feeling. Ever.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: (moribund) Great. I’m so happy for you.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Well then--nothing’s wrong. Right? She sits up facing him, summoning her courage.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Everything’s wrong. If Hook doesn’t kill you today, you get your kids and go home--where you belong. Peter turns away, speechless. He wasn’t ready for this.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I/ll...come back.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: No you won't. It/1l be just like before. You’1l forget. This place won’t mean anything anymore. Neither will I. I/11 never see you again. She runs crying behind a tiny dressing curtain. Her silhouette shaking--face buried in her tiny hands.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Wait--Tink--I-- She SCREAMS in anguish. Her light winks out behind he curtain. Peter panics. He checks. She’s gone!

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: TINK!? Wait.... Tink’s aura glows strong on his back--filling the entire treehouse room. Peter turns facing an absolute vision.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Oh...Tink...you’re... big...

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: It’s the only wish I ever made for myself. Radiant in her gown, she lets down long flowing tresses cascading around her shoulders. He tries to speak. Tink covers his lips--

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: I love you Peter. I always have. Let this be our one time together-- Peter slides his arms around her, lost in her eyes, her hair, all that she is-- .

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Then, even when we’re apart.... «..We’ll always have Neverland.... Yes! YES! Their lips draw closer--closer-- A CANNON SHOT WHINES OVERHEAD. AN EXPLOSION 0.C. rocks th treehouse. The roof crashes down. Peter covers Tink.
PETER’S POV - THROUGH THE WINDOW - THE AVENGER Another round EXPLODES in the Cove. The Lost Boys are up and active. Ziggy points from the Crow’s nest.

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: Hook!.He’s attacking! PETER’S TELESCOPE POV - HOOK’S SHIP Oars churning. Pirates on the rigging unfurling sails. Lo Tom fires again. The shot lands dangerously close to the Avenger.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Tink! This is it! He turns from the telescope mounted at the window. His heart sinks. Their one passionate moment is gone~--foreve TINK BELTS on her dagger, back to pixie size. Her feisty self once again.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: What are you looking at? Let’s go save your kids.... (she blasts him with pixie dust) Eat your heart out, flyboy. She flies out the window. Peter closes his eyes, lamentin the one who got away. He curses Hook and flies after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A round screams overhead. The TREEHOUSE BLOWS UP!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. HOOK’S SHIP - UNDERWAY - DAWN A kid-sized CAPT. HOOK, complete with wide hat, long coat and sword, raises his hand beside the Long Tom cannon. It Jack!. He turns, smoking a cigar. Even an eyepatch.

dialogues.speaker: FIRE
dialogues.text: He ignites the fuse port. Long Tom FIRES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The round explodes against the cliffs cascading rocks dow onto the Indian village below.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: Hook lounges in his great chair checking Jack’s destructi with opera glasses. He laughs with sadistic delight.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Ah, the Indians are awake. Good form... "Son". I believe you’ve got it. A SLAVE BOY beats a drum roll. SMEE spiels through a megaphone, doing "color". .

dialogues.speaker: SMEE
dialogues.text: Good mawnin’ Neverland! It’s a perfect day for the Never War. Captain James Hook’s Crew is fit and ready for blood.

dialogues.speaker: ALONG THE GUNWALES
dialogues.text: Pirates ready for battle. Loading cannons, sharpening swords, adjusting their eyepatches--

dialogues.speaker: SMEE
dialogues.text: --The forces of Pan--according to latest scouting reports--don’t have a snow ball’s chance in hell of a win. So--LET THE WAR BEGIN! CHEERS go up from the Pirates. Driven to animal frenzy by the long awaited "urge to kill". JACK parades on the quarterdeck, "hook style".

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: This is more fun than Ninetendo. (raising his spyglass) Range 500 yards....elevation... On my command. FIRE! Pirates reload and duck. The ramrod still in the barrel. Jack hits the fuse. BOOM! The ramrod sails through the ai Hook cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINCESS TI stands in the lead War Canoe. MORE WARRIORS launch outriggers in the b.g. The cannon shot screams overhead. WATER EXPLODES beside her. She doesn’t blink, fastening her leather helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost Boys hammer launch blocks. Rufio hacks the mooring ropes. Tink flies to Ziggy in the crow’s nest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They’re rounding the point! Peter flies by hacking the other mooring rope clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take command, Rufe. Go for his sails first. I’m counting on you.

dialogues.speaker: RUFIO
dialogues.text: You got it, Mon. I mean, "Cap’n Pan". Rufio swings aboard on his line, pumped up. ACE salutes from the deck with the other boys. Peter salutes back.

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: Don’d ged killed, "parameezeum braid."

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (fondly) Get outta here, "scum face"! The Dark Avenger slides into the water with a big SPLASH. Lost Boys cheer on deck. Ziggy unfurls their flag--A HOOK IN A RED CIRCLE WITH THE "NO" SLASH through it! "NO HOOK" Peter exults. He climbs with Tink and speeds toward Hook’ ship in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. HOOK’S SHIP - CROW’S NEST - DAWN

dialogues.speaker: LOOKOUT PIRATE
dialogues.text: (pointing) Skins! Dead ahead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ti leads 7 War canoes toward Hook’s ship.

dialogues.speaker: _ HOOK
dialogues.text: (opera glasses up) Oh, goody. "Skins". Live targets at last Jack. Lucky for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ty a
Jack stares at the approaching Indians in shock. "Live?"

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Come about, Mr. Smee. Engage. SMEE SPINS the wheel. The mighty ship comes about.

dialogues.speaker: SMEE
dialogues.text: (on megaphone) And we pick up the pace here in this first round of action-- The SLAVE BOY beats his drum faster. PIRATES TAKE AIM, pounding their weapons hungry for a "kill".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOODLER CRACKS his whip up one side of the Slaves and dow the other. JUKES POUNDS the rowing beat faster.

dialogues.speaker: JUKES
dialogues.text: Pull--you little vermin. Pull yer bleedin’ guts out-- MAGGIE, dirty and weak, is too short to row, being lifted and dumped with each stroke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tink and Peter swing wide out to sea witha breathtaking view. They bank toward Hook’s ship in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ti signals. Warriors loose a flight of arrows. Many aflam EXT. HOOK’S SHIP - COMING ABOUT . Jack hides behind Long Tom as arrows land everywhere. H doesn’t move, daring any shaft to hit him. He grabs one i flight and blows out the flame.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Do you believe those Skins? Shooting at us with their little bows and arrows. How primitive. Pirates drop from the rigging, stuck with arrows. Flamers hit the fo’scle. The canvas ignites.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (pointing at the flames)

CANNONS THUNDER in a 12 gun broadside! JACK clutches his ears, quaking with each blast. EXT. WAR CANOES - BEARING DOWN ON HOOK’S SHIP 3 EXPLODE with direct hits. Warriors hit the water. Ti presses on. Warriors fire a flight. Arrows fil] the sk MERMAIDS SURFACE. Angelika grabs a wounded Warrior pullin him toward shore. Una and Babs share another. EXT. HOOK’S SHIP - QUARTERDECK Pirates cheer the destruction. More arrows rain down. HOO FINDS JACK cowering in the smoke.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Your first broadside, Jack. Good forn.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It was an accident. 1 didn’t mean to hurt anybody.

dialogues.speaker: . HOOK
dialogues.text: nase) (jerking Jack up) ~ But that’s the idea! what’s a few less Skins anyway. You're going to be a Pirate--feared on the 7 seas! Jack pulls away, terrified. He freezes--pointing starboar

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: THE DARK AVENGER
dialogues.text: Bearing down from the cove. Giant sling weapon and Lost Boys visible on deck. The "NO HOOK" flag waving Proudly.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: (peering through opera glasses) The Lost Boys. What a weenie roast! No sign of Pan. Where is that green wuss?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (pointing astern)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NA Hook pivots his opera glasses astern.

dialogues.speaker: TWO SPECKS
dialogues.text: Bright green. Headed for the ship. Glowing like UFOS.

dialogues.speaker: WITH PETER AND TINK
dialogues.text: He draws his sword, dropping the scabbard into the sea. H levels it and yells the "charge". Tink yells with him.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: Staring through his opera glasses in total disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Pan...HAH! Got his wings back, did he? _ (calling out with glee)

dialogues.speaker: SMEEEE
dialogues.text: SMEE is all smiles urging the slave boy to drum faster.

dialogues.speaker: SMEE
dialogues.text: (megaphone) See Cap’n--dreams do come true.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Shoot it Jack! The big green one. Jack instantly sights along the barrel at the aproaching objects. He puffs his cigar--coughing--lowering it to fir

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (in the distance)

dialogues.speaker: JACKKKK
dialogues.text: Jack freezes in total shock. Hook groans, grimacing.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Dad?...My Dad’s flying? He hates to fly.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Don’t think, Jack, just do. This is what you’ve been training for. Shoot him. Do it.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You put that cannon down right now, young man! Peter, the parent again, suddenly loses altitude. Tink pulls him back up.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: There he goes again, telling you what to do. Don’t listen to him. Shut him up, Jack....forever. Jack weakens--lowering the cigar to the fuse--

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I love you Jack!

dialogues.speaker: . HOOK
dialogues.text: He said the "L" word. You know what that means--right Jack?! SHOOT HIM! It’s what you want to do.

dialogues.speaker: / JACK
dialogues.text: (snapping)

dialogues.speaker: NOOO00
dialogues.text: --pulling away--Hook forces Jack’s cigar down on the fuse

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Lookout! She RAMS Peter sending him tumbling off course. The Cannon shot SMACKS TINK like a freight train and EXPLODES! Tink is gone! Glowing dust sprinkles the sea. PETER SPIRALS UP to the heavens, screaming in horror.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Hook exults. Jack runs away, convulsing in angry tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lost Boys watch horrified as Pixie dust settles.

dialogues.speaker: RUFIO
dialogues.text: "NO HOOK"! No HOOK--NO HOOK--~ The boys pick up the cry Pulling back a giant arrow in th huge cross-bow cum slingshot mounted forward, The arrow i covered with grafitti. "HOOK IS A CODFISH", "HOOK sucks", "LOST Boys RULE", "pay LIVES"... ; ."TInk FOREVER" The giant arrow RUSHES FORWARD arcing into the sky. EXT. HOOK’s SHIP - HIGH ANGLE - LOOKING DOWN Cannons fire blowing canoes away on the Portside. cannons fire ripping into the Avenger off to Starboard, The giant arrow CRASHES into the mainmast tearing away th sails. The top mizzen mast falls like a felled tree, HOOK & SMEE watch in disbelier. The mast splats in the se

dialogues.speaker: SMEE
dialogues.text: Is that fair, Cap'n?

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Attack speed! Ram those little bastards! g » Smee ducks flaming rigging crashing down. He spins th wheel aiming for the Avenger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAGGIE and Slaves row at killer Pace under Noodler’s whip EXT. HOOK’S SHIP - PETER FLYING He bursts through the billowing cannon smoke, his Sword u like a Samurai hacking and chopping and bending each oar until it breaks--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oars break sending Slaves tumbling like dominoes. Noodler whips mercilessly, Maggie and the Young Slave pul hard. Their oars Snap--they sail--knocking Noodler down. The Young slave smacks Noodler with his chain. Maggie gra the key. She unlocks manacles as fast as she can.

dialogues.speaker: ON DECK
dialogues.text: \ _Aring his pistols at Peter just missing -him.
Ve

PIl iS FIRE FROM THE GUNWALES As Peter darts and weaves hacking oars. A CANNON FIRES in front of Peter. He ducks back. Another FIRES behind him. EXT. HOOK’S SHIP - PORT SIDE War canoes draw alongside. TI LEAPS scaling the hull. Warriors follow. Arrows fly. Pirates drop. Guns fire. Indians fall. EXT. HOOK’S SHIP & THE DARK AVENGER - SIDE BY SIDE ACE & Rufio release catapults. Rocks fly. quick CUTS: ROCKS CRASH onto the deck. Pirates scatter. ROCKS CRASH into gunports smashing cannon. ROCKS CRACK the hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ROCK CRASHES through. WATER SPEWS in. Mag - keeps unlocking chains. JUKES APPEARS. He grabs her lifv ug her up, choking her--- A BELAYING PIN SMACKS him in the head with deadly accurac He stiffens upright, choking Maggie harder. ANOTHER PIN BONKS HIM. He falls-- REVEALING: JACK! He runs to Maggie hugging her tight.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Jack--I thought--you were ‘one of then.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (major guilt) I’m sorry Maggie--I almost was--Dad’s here! I saw him! He’s....Peter Pan! Maggie gapes. A CHEER GOES UP from the Slaves. Jack leads them toward the hatch--taking command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK AND MAGGIE lead the Slaves pouring from the hatch. \ CHEER GOES UP as TI leads her Warriors swarming over th side clashing hand to hand with the Pirates. \ ChozR GOES UP as ZIGGY catapults himself from the Aveng crashing into 4 Pirates--knocking them overboard.
RUFIO LEAPS like a madman into the fray. ACE leads the others onboard Slashing and cutting.

dialogues.speaker: WITH HOOK
dialogues.text: Pacing the quarterdeck, watching the battle before hin.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: The Lost Boys. No manners. Despicable. He whirls and skewers a Young Slave with a harpoon.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Look at the Rugrats! They should all be Slaves. I HATE KIDS! ESPECIALLY PAN’S! 3 WARRIORS RUSH HIM. Hook runs 2 through and shoots one.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Skins at least die nobly. BUT NO PAN! The ship lists. smee fights the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're sinking, Cap’n. Fast. Hook STOMPS his boots in a big circle throwing a tantrum.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Damn-~damn--damn--damn--damn--Pan!

dialogues.speaker: YOU BIG CHICKENNNN
dialogues.text: PETER DESCENDS landing behind Hook. Classic pose.

dialogues.speaker: . PETER
dialogues.text: i know you are but what am I?!! Hook turns facing hin. Long slow serpentine smile. At las

dialogues.speaker: _ HOOK
dialogues.text: -+++Peter Pan. Has it been 3 days? Surprise. Surprise. How time flies. Smee crawls unseen behind the wheel. Peter is all concentration. Eyes fixed on Hook waiting for his move.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: (looking around) Where is Miss Bell? Shopping?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (flashing deep anger) You know where she is. I want my kids.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: "Proud insolent youth--prepare to die."

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: "To die will be an awfully big adventure."

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t bet the ranch on it. They leap at each other. swoRDS CLANGING in the morning sun. The ultimate duel between good and evil has begun.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW THEM AROUND THE QUARTERDECK
dialogues.text: Hook, a superior swordsman, attacks. Peter parries the ra of blows and thrusts, fighting for his life.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: You look marvelous. An amazing comeback, . I must say. A 3 day wonder. How dia you | do it? Diet? Exercise?....An affair Perhaps. The right woman can do wonders to restore a man’s youth. Hmnmm? Peter surges with anger on the attack. Gaining confidence “4s instinctive skilis returning. Darting and flying to oid Hook’s slashes and slices——

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Look at you, Pan. Healthy. Fit. No bills! No nagging wife! You’re having fun! Admit it! What a shame you have to die. Just when you find "life", | Peter hesitates. The truth. smee Crawls dragging a chain with a manacle trying to trap Peter’s feet. He lunges, ju missing--as Peter flies on the attack--

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I/11 kill you, Hook! Hook dodges his thrust and slices Peter along the ribs.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Wrong. You’re the one who's bleeding. Peter stares at the blood seeping from his side. The ship lists acutely. CANNON BALLS roll across the deck Peter hovers and Hook dodges them as they fight--Peter taking the offensive driving Hook back.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MAIN DECK
dialogues.text: Jack spots Peter and Hook Pointing them out to Maggie, That's Daday? She’s elated ang terrified at the same time watching her Father drive Hook back--then fly to avoid Hook’s attack, A PIRATE SCREAMS behind them--sword raised, ZIGGY SWINGS on a Tope blamming the Pirate with a ramrod the groin. Flaming rigging crashes down Separating them. Peter leaps flying up ang over the debris landing in front of Hook,

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: T love it when you do that, They lock Swords--a test of strength as each tries to sho the other overboard. "Why did Hook wait so long to find me?" T/1l teil you. When you were young, you made a fool of me. All the time. I was no match for the Great Pan. i + YOU were 7 you said, Not anymore. Even at the Peak of your form you're just "old Peter Pan", He shoves Peter over the gunwale pressing his Hook down inches fron Peter’s eyes,

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: However, 1 haven't aged a day. Ne’re even! Peter rolis away. Hook buries his claw in the rail. He whirls Slicing Peter in the thigh as he flies away.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Whoopsy. Not @s quick as we use@ to be, are "We"....
Peter clutches his leg in pain. He’s scared to death, but he fights on.

dialogues.speaker: NEAR THE MAIN MAST
dialogues.text: Rufio fights 3 Pirates at once. Ti guts one. ACE throws another overboard. Ziggy shields Maggie and Jack. Rufio doesn’t have to be told who they are.

dialogues.speaker: RUFIO
dialogues.text: Get to the Avenger. This wreck’s sinkin’ fast, Mon.

dialogues.speaker: TI
dialogues.text: Go! We will help Pan! Pirates cut them off. ACE boosts Maggie onto the rigging. Pirate grabs her leg. She kicks him in the face. ziggy pitches Jack a sword. He clubs a Pirate with it. THE CROW’S NEST - LOOKING DOWN - JACK AND MAGGIE Climb to the tiny bucket hanging on the remains of the mast. The battle rages below.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Battle on the ornately carved stern over the great cabin. The stern rises into the air as the ship continues to sin bow first. Peter falls, favoring his wounded leg.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Aw--we're not getting tired are we?

dialogues.speaker: DADDYYYY
dialogues.text: Smee appears over the edge with the manacle--closer--Pete looks up spotting his kids. IN THE CROW’S NEST - LOOKING DOWN Jack and Maggie can see everything. Even Smee---

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND YOUUUU
dialogues.text: Too late. SMEE SLAMS the manacles around Peter’s ankle. PETER FLIES! He slams to the ground--A BALL AND CHAIN locked on his leg!

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: (he preens) Advantage...Hook! HOOK CHOPS at Peter chasing him across the deck. Peter flies a few feet, tugging, dragging the chain, dodging, circling,: blocking Hook’s blows.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHIP HEELS
dialogues.text: THE MAST CRACKS! JACK AND MAGGIE teeter in the bucket. RUFIO & TI race to the rescue. FLAMES ROAR UP from the ma hatch, cutting them off. The DECK EXPLODES driving them back. JACK AND MAGGIE duck in the bucket as the fireball roars up. Flames lick the mast pole toward them. PIRATES LEAP OVERBOARD, abandoning ship.

dialogues.speaker: ONBOARD THE AVENGER
dialogues.text: ACE and Ziggy leap aboard with other Lost Boys and Skins.

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: We can’t leeve Pedur!

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: Peter circles him like a bird on a string. Hook yanks his chain, pulling Peter toward him like a balloon, fighting Slicing. Peter flies away only to be jerked back again.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: What a waste. The real world has taken its toll on you, Peter. Too much stress. Too much tension. Too bad--- The deck pitches. The ball rolls toward the fiery hold dragging Peter with it. Helpless. Fighting on his back. Suddenly Rufio leaps in front of Hook, attacking with a vengeance. Hook toys with him.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Get away, Rufe--It’s me he wants!

dialogues.speaker: RUFIO
dialogues.text: Looky, looky, I got Hooky.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Sadly, you have no future as a poet.
O He runs Rufio through. The boys sag smiling at Peter--

dialogues.speaker: RUFIO
dialogues.text: You...are...Peter...Pan...-Mon..- --and falls backwards overboard. TI LEAPS from nowhere landing on Hook’s back wielding her machete. Hook grabs her hair and kisses her!--She spits i his face--He heaves her screaming over the side. The ship heaves. Peter’s ball and chain drops into the flaming hold PULLING PETER, screaming, with it. THE CROW’S NEST - JACK AND MAGGIE Helpless, watching him fall a second time to certain deat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter grabs a deck beam hanging on for dear life. HOOK stands over him--his moment of triumph.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: This. is it, Pan. Big Daddy fear is here! The fear you feel when your children don’t come home on time. When the plane takes off. Or the fear you feel when you can’t run as fast anymore and your body aches. I’m the quickie at the office--The Porsche and the red head with the big hooters. Take a good look. I’m your mortality, bucko. jm your Christmas present from hell! He raises his sword to chop off Peter’s hand---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sticking Hook right in the ass! Hook rears in excruciatin pain pulling the blade from his buttocks. His hands cover in a putrid purple liquid.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: My...own...blood. You know--I really

dialogues.speaker: HATE THE SIGHT OF MY OWN BLOOD
dialogues.text: A FLASH OF LIGHT zooms by him diving into the void. THE CROW’S NEST - JACK AND MAGGIE The ship shudders again. The last rigging falls away. The wast sways--cracking more. Flames surge up-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flash of light swirls around, landing on his manacle. It’s TINK! Hair singed, Big powder burns--but alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tink! You’re alive! I thought I’d lost you forever--

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Say it, Peter. I wanna hear you say it--AND MEAN IT THIS TIME--

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (his hands slip)

dialogues.speaker: BELIEVE--I DO--
dialogues.text: Satisfied, Tink picks the lock with a faerie bobby pin. T ball. and chain drops into the inferno. THE HOLD EXPLODES! TINK & PETER SURGE UP from the blast-- TO THE CROW’S NEST Now teetering dangerously. Peter hovers alongside his kid hugging them--kissing them--

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: ¢’mon--We're going to fly! The kids hug the mast, terrified, shaking "no". Crying--

dialogues.speaker: BELOW
dialogues.text: At his wit’s end, alone on deck--He grabs a broadaxe and hacks like a mad man at the remains of the mast.

dialogues.speaker: , HOOK
dialogues.text: (child’s voice) "Oh, Daddy, I’m afraid"---KIDS RUIN EVERYTHING, PAN. DON’T YOU GET IT.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE
dialogues.text: Jack and Maggie lurch and sway. Peter stays with then.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Don’t listen to him. Take my hands. Jack! Believe me. Please, Maggie, you have to. Believe in yourselves. You can do anything if you believe in yourself!

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: THEY WON’T TAKE CARE OF YOU WHEN

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Tink--dust’em! She splashes them with Pixie dust. They glow: Maggie reaches out, taking hold. Jack hangs back, unsure.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Do what your Father says. You’ve got 2 seconds to find a happy thought!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Home!

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Yeah--Momny! Jack grabs Peter’s hand. The mast collapses! They jump--

dialogues.speaker: FALLING AT US
dialogues.text: ROARING RIGHT OVER HOOK and up into the morning sky!

dialogues.text: PAN! YOU’LL NEVER WORK IN NEVERLAND

dialogues.text: Tink looks back. She sees Peter clutching his head. He waves her on. She understands.

dialogues.text: HOOKKKKKKkKkk!
