dialogues.speaker: EXT.
dialogues.text: A ferocious storm. More THUNDER CRACKS! INT. GRANNY WENDY’S BEDROOM - CONTINUING ACTION Moira spills her tea. Her nerves shot. GRANNY WENDY sits in bed. Battling the unseen force--

dialogues.speaker: GRANNY WENDY
dialogues.text: Moira? The children-- A THUNDERING CRASH boom upstairs. The lights wink out! MOIRA BOUNDS UP THE STAIRS--a flashlight waving wildly--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windows flap open. Rain blasts in. Moira struggles to close them. Granny Wendy straggles in--weak, unsteady. LIGHTNING FLASHES! Granny Wendy cries out-~- JACK AND MAGGIE are hiding under their covers, crying and calling out. Moira rushes to them, hugging them, kissing their drenched wet faces. Both kids babble frantic--

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We’re back, Mommy--we made it.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: There were all these Pirates--and Daddy saved. us--We flew!

dialogues.speaker: GRANNY WENDY
dialogues.text: It’s all right, dears, you’re safe.

dialogues.speaker: MOIRA
dialogues.text: Where’s your father. Where is he?! They point to the window. Thunder! Lightning blinds them!

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: True blue. Almost too perfect. Gulls cry. GOD’S POV - LOOKING DOWN Raindrops drip from trees. A familiar grassy knoll. Lush. Manicured. PETER! Sprawled lifeless. Just as he was when first woke in Neverland. THE VIEW DESCENDS right to his face. No vital signs. A raindrop splatters his nose. He flinches.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (delerious) Jack...Maggie...fly... Another hits him. He sits up slowly looking around. He stands panicked. Not again! His clothes are tattered and torn. He doesn’t know which way to go. Something rustles the bushes. He turns--ready to fight--- A cricket ball crashes through the brush and rolls to his feet. He stares at it--as if it might explode. He picks i up--turning it in his hands. A YOUNG KID crashes through the brush in a ball uniforn. He’s eyes Peter in his dirty duds. Peter frowns, in a fog

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Here--gimme yat ball, y’sodder-- Peter pitches it back following the kid through the bushe

dialogues.speaker: THE VIEW ASCENDS REVEALING
dialogues.text: Round Pound. The manicured green filled with PEOPLE playi cricket. Peter takes it all in--thoroughly confused.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL, (0C)
dialogues.text: Mom--there’s Peter Pan-- A LITTLE GIRL points at Peter--then runs past him to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frozen in time. Forever young. Peter fixes on it. Somethi clicks. :

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: My kids..... The MOTHER eyes Peter suspiciously asshe retrieves her little girl. Peter. suddenly, anxious, starts te jog away

dialogues.speaker: TINK, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Goodbye Peter. I love you.... He stops--turning back to the statue, as if it spoke to him.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Tink? A GROUNDS KEEPER sweeps some empty bottles across the cement path. "Tink-tink-tink"--

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (thinking) Tink... He shrugs. Whatever it meant, he’s already forgotten. Wit new life, he races away down the path. THE VIEW CLIMBS TO: TINKERBELL! Standing behind the statue’s head. Her back to us as she watches Peter pickin up speed, pulling farther away, until he’s gone. Tink turns. Glowing tears dot her face. She flies away.

dialogues.text: Maggie, Jack and Tootles peer out the closed window. -Morose. Suddenly Maggie lights up--jumping and pointing.

dialogues.speaker: WITH PETER
dialogues.text: He stops, instinctively looking up to the window. He jump up and down when he sees them--"they’re alive"! Hooting a celebrating life--the "new" Peter hops up on the garden wall and walks it--doing exactly what he told Jack not to do--He makes it--all the way--without falling! Bowing to his children applauding in the window, he leaps the garden fence and dashes the shortcut to the front doo

dialogues.text: Moira opens the door. Peter bursts in--sweeps Moira off h feet laughing like a lovesick teenager--and a serious kis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Peter---Peter--I thought I’d lost you. All of you. Bhat Last '’ 2

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (shocked confused) Last night? I--don’t know,..All I know is--I love you Moira. I love you! Maggie skitters down the stairs and sails into Peter's ar dust Like she flew.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Daddy! I knew you'd come back. T never gave up. Peter is suddenly facing Granny Wendy. He bows to her beautifully. (the way Pan did when he first net Wendy) PETER . Hulle, Wendy Moira Angela Darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hullo, Peter. Do you know where you are?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Where I...belong. Where I want to be. They enbrace, filled with emotion and unconditional love. Peter spots Tootles watchiig at the foot of the stairs. H can’t speak. He just grabs Peter and hugs him tight.”

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (something clicks) Tootles--I've got something--1 think belongs to you. I don’t remember-- He removes the pouch from his neck. Tootles brightens, barely able to contain himself. Peter pours the marbles into his gnarly hands---

dialogues.speaker: TOOTLES
dialogues.text: See?--I didn’t lose ny marbles afterall. Granny Wendy hugs him warmly. Tootles drifts upstairs, caressing his happy thoughts. He passes Jack--waiting on the stairs--feeling guilty--cut off.
Peter reaches up with both arms--just like his father and mother did---Jack can’t fight his tears. ‘JACK JUMPS--fly into his Daddy’s arms. Moira hugs them both.

dialogues.speaker: MOIRA
dialogues.text: You’re all safe. We’re together. We can just be the way we were...before.....

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (lucid, focused) I love all of you so much. But we/ll never be the same as before. There’s something we’ve got to do. All of us-- He leaps up and touches the chandeleir--then bounds quick upstairs, leading them all--Granny Wendy, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter leads his family toward it--He scowls angry-- PETER . What did I tell you about this window? Huh? Well, let’s open it! Anger melts to mirth. He unlocks it throwing it open wide Jack and Maggie open the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Darling/Bannings together. Joyous. Facing the world.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Take a deep breath everybody. Breathe. It’s a great day to be alive. From now on--in this family--everyday is a great day--to be alive...

dialogues.speaker: THE VIEW CLIMBS UP UP UP
dialogues.text: Up through the clouds. We bank in a sweeping arc over Big Bend and the Thames River. London gleams in the morning sun. TOOTLES SWOOPS INTO VIEW! Whooping with pure joy. He shakes the last of Tink’s pixie dust from his marble pouc on his craggy face, basking in the golden glow. He pauses and waves goodbye to each of us. Then zooms awa heading for Neverland. Laughing like that child he was. T child we all were. The child in us that can never die.
